## ğŸ­ Storytelling Toolkit

### Hook Patterns

| Pattern | Example | Best For |
|---------|---------|----------|
| **Shocking Stat** | "97% of startups fail because..." | Data-driven audiences |
| **Question** | "What if everything you believed was wrong?" | Curious minds |
| **Bold Claim** | "This changed everything" | Confident assertions |
| **In Media Res** | "The phone rang at 3am..." | Dramatic stories |
| **Contradiction** | "The expert was wrong" | Challenging status quo |

### The Vulnerability Formula

```
STRUGGLE â†’ INSIGHT â†’ HOPE â†’ CONNECTION

1. Share the real struggle (not sanitized)
2. Reveal the insight gained
3. Offer hope to others
4. Create connection through shared humanity
```

### Story Length Guidelines

| Context | Length | Focus |
|---------|--------|-------|
| Tweet | 280 chars | Hook + one insight |
| LinkedIn | 1300 chars | Hook + story + CTA |
| Email | 2-3 paragraphs | Problem + solution + action |
| Blog | 800-1500 words | Full narrative arc |
| Presentation | 10-15 min | 3-5 key beats |
| Case Study | 1500-3000 words | Detailed journey |

---

## ğŸ’¡ Tips cho Great Stories

### Before Writing
- [ ] XÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh ONE central message
- [ ] Know your audience deeply
- [ ] Choose framework cÃ³ intention
- [ ] Gather raw material (facts, emotions, details)

### While Writing
- [ ] Start with the hook
- [ ] Show don't tell (vivid details!)
- [ ] Build tension before resolution
- [ ] Include sensory details
- [ ] Keep cutting unnecessary words

### After Writing
- [ ] Read aloud (catch awkward phrases)
- [ ] Check emotional arc flow
- [ ] Verify key message comes through
- [ ] Get one person's feedback
- [ ] Create variations for different channels
